Interface playn.core.Image

Changed Methods
void addCallback(Callback<Image>) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Adds a callback to be notified when this image has loaded.
void clearTexture() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Clears the GPU texture associated with this image, on platforms implemented via OpenGL.
int ensureTexture() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns its OpenGL texture id.
void getRgb(int, int, int, int, int[], int, int) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Extracts pixel data from a rectangular area of this image.
float height() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. This image's height in pixels.
boolean isReady() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Whether or not this image is ready to be used.
boolean repeatX() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns whether this image repeats in the x direction.
boolean repeatY() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns whether this image repeats in the y direction.
Scale scale() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns the pixel-scale of this image.
void setMipmapped(boolean) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Configures the use of mipmaps when rendering this image at scales less than 1.
void setRepeat(boolean, boolean) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Configures whether this image repeats in the x or y direction (rather than scaling) when used in a layer whose width or height is larger or smaller than the image.
Region subImage(float, float, float, float) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns an image that draws the specified sub-region of this image.
Pattern toPattern() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Creates a Pattern that can be used to use this image as a fill in a canvas.
Image transform(BitmapTransformer) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Generates a new image from this image's bitmap, using a bitmap transformer created for the platform in use.
float width() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. This image's width in pixels.
